title: Hey everyone!
body:
I’ve been doing a few more art things lately, including adding to my circular gallifreyan series for Critical Role.

If you want to maybe support me in that endeavor while I do the college thing heres a link to my ko-fi! It would be super awesome if you could

Much love <3

summary:
You: it's Wednesday you know what that means!? It's hump day! 
Me, an intellectual: it's Wednesday you know what that means?!...
body:
You: it’s Wednesday you know what that means!? It’s hump day!

Me, an intellectual: it’s Wednesday you know what that means?! It’s critical role eve!

title: Critical Role ep 43
body:
That could have gone a lot worse than it did. Although, we’re now setting off to sea in a ship in fairly appalling condition; good luck ever getting the smell of burnt wood out of your hair, guys.

Although considering what other fates could have occurred very easily to your heads besides smelling smoky on top of your shoulders… yeah. Let’s not complain.

(also, oh Caleb, that was valiantly done again. Please let’s let him rest.)

reblog.comment:

(also, oh Caleb, that was valiantly done again. Please let’s let him rest.)

blog.name: bixbiboom
blog.title: I myself am also Enchanter Pumat Sol

Bixbi, older than you.

Fat queer of indeterminate origin.

Possibly a lesser demon.

Hellenist serving Hestia, Hermes and Chiron.

Critical Role has taken over my life and my blog.

Taliesin Jaffe is my boyfriend.

I love you.

#eyesnevershut

tags: beau is adopted by the brenattos au
haw yee this was so fun to write
less fun to re read and check for spellings
summary: I love the Veth adopts Beau au! Not to add angst (except totally to add angst) what if Beau comes back from the Cobalt Soul to...
question: I love the Veth adopts Beau au! Not to add angst (except totally to add angst) what if Beau comes back from the Cobalt Soul to find her mother gone, taken by the goblins and a mysterious woman, and decides to hunt the woman down for answers and revenge, and along the way she meets the M9 and Nott, who has to try and hide the awful, painful truth from her little girl (she doesn't even know if Beau would believe her if she told her the truth) until she can't hide her identity anymore
answer:
I am so down for angst hell yes, this prompt is fucking delicious, let’s go-

  • When beau first gets the letter to come home, she’s excited.
  • She knows that yeza and veth have been trying for a third kid, and it’s not really the news to spread in a letter, so she swings by xenoth’s office, says she’s taking some personal time, and heads out
  • She can hear him yelling ‘monks don’t take personal time, beauregard!’ all the way across the grounds, and smiles a little
  • He’s high strung, but he cares about her, in his way
  • She just wishes it would maybe manifest itself as less lectures about how to be a Proper Monk
  • She hightails it home, and doesn’t realize something’s wrong until she sees that the apothecary is closed
  • It’s midday, they never close during the day
  • She ducks under the doorway, as is habit, and sees the circles under yeza’s eyes.
  • Sees the trauma lurking in luke’s and wants to pummel whoever put that into her brother’s eyes into the fucking ground
  • Looks around and doesn’t see veth. Stills, and asks in a trembling voice, “dad?”
  • He lurches forward, clinging to her, and whispers, “i’m so sorry”
  • They all start crying, and end up curled on the couch
  • He tells her the story, of how the winter had apparently been bad enough for the goblins that they got desperate. Enough to strike at the town. To take hostages. To take her family.
  • She has to pause there, as her vision whites out with the towering rage she feels at these, these creatures, these fucking disgusting, horrible- she takes deep breaths, until she feels less like she’s shattering into dozens of jagged shards, and keeps listening
  • Hears how her parents were tortured. Her brother starved. And has to breathe deeper
  • How desperate they’d gotten. Their frantic plan, whispered in the dark as luke shivered with fever
  • How they’d run and run and then veth had turned to him and kissed him fiercely and told him, “take our boy and go!” and lured the goblins away
  • How he’d barely made it to felderwin long enough for a crownsguard to see him
  • How they’d waited for a few days for her to come but- but. Nothing.
  • How there’d been a search party sent out (“i had to yell at them, beau. I nearly- i nearly threw acid in the lawmaster’s face because she didn’t think vethy was worth it-”)
  • But there’d been nothing-
  • And then there’d been her body
  • He’d sent the letter as soon as he’d been able to write, but he knew how slow mail could be
  • “We’re- having the funeral tomorrow. Only- only family”
  • And they had her funeral
  • Veth’s brothers came back from where they’d scattered, and beau held luke close throughout, and stared studiously forward. Her casket was filled with flowers, ones they’d all picked themselves from about the fields, but not a single one was as beautiful as her mom, even dead
  • After the funeral, beau stays with yeza and luke. She sends a terse letter explaining everything to xenoth, so he doesn’t get her kicked out, and ignores every letter he sends back
  • Eventually, her sadness is overaken by anger. Rage, at the creatures that had killed her mother (had tortured her, she’d seen the marks on her arms and legs, and painted across her neck)
  • So, she pays a group of crownsguard that look sufficiently competent, and storms a goblin camp
  • She can admit it’s not her best plan, and that she nearly dies far too many times, but- but, it does give her something. Information. A purpose. There was a woman- not a goblin, but they never saw her face.
  • She was hired to make the halfling woman suffer.
  • Beau gets everything she can from the little cretins, and then throws them away
  • She sees the looks the crownsguard are giving her, and throws them more gold. They look away
  • She goes back to home, and tells yeza she has to leave
  • He knows (always a fighter)
  • So she heads out
  • Does some adventuring on the side, to keep her pockets full (or full enough)
  • Meets a sly half orc and an overly optimistic tiefling and decides to stick with them, but doesn’t forget what goal she’s set out for herself
  • Meets the rest of them
  • Tries not to snarl when she sees nott
  • Gets to know her more, and it’s easier to separate her from the monsters that tortured her mother. They didn’t wear porcelain masks or carry ever-flowing flasks
  • —
  • When she first sees the dark skinned monk in blue robes across the tavern, she thinks, it can’t be. And then the tiefling catches her staring and their groups combine and she’s looking into the bright, beautiful, fierce blue eyes of her daughter, and she can’t-
  • She takes a big, long swig from her flask and deals with it, because fleeing from the table would not be conducive to keeping secrets
  • She sees how beau looks at her, the first few weeks they’re together
  • Can feel the hate and disgust she’s trying (and failing) to tamp down, and it hurts because she knew, knew that she couldn’t have gone back, but to have confirmed feels like a little piece of her soul has been burned away
  • Slowly, slowly, things get better
  • And then it all comes crumbling down around her when they go back to felderwin. Yeza is gone
  • Taken
  • And there’s no way to hide who she is, anymore.
  • —-
  • As nott tells her story, beau gets a twisty, sick feeling in her stomach
  • And then, those bright yellow eyes are turned on her, and she learns that her mother isn’t actually dead, but it’s almost, somehow, worse, because the way she’d treated her when they’d first met comes flooding back
  • And, and, beau doesn’t care if the rest of the group is still watching because, her mom’s not dead
  • And she’d missed her so much
  • (Caduceus herds the rest of them upstairs, and they wait, and give the two time. And themselves, time, to adjust to this drastic shift in group dynamics)
  • There’s lots of crying, and a little bit of anger on beau’s part, and way, way too much self loathing on nott’s veth’s mom’s part
  • But- her mom’s alive. Greener, and slightly, different from before, but alive, and in front of her
  • And that’s what matters
  • (i really need to figure out how to do read mores on asks, this is getting ridiculous)

  • Eventually, her sadness is overaken by anger. Rage, at the creatures that had killed her mother (had tortured her, she’d seen the marks on her arms and legs, and painted across her neck)
  • So, she pays a group of crownsguard that look sufficiently competent, and storms a goblin camp
  • She can admit it’s not her best plan, and that she nearly dies far too many times, but- but, it does give her something. Information. A purpose. There was a woman- not a goblin, but they never saw her face.
  • She was hired to make the halfling woman suffer.
  • Beau gets everything she can from the little cretins, and then throws them away
  • She sees the looks the crownsguard are giving her, and throws them more gold. They look away
  • She goes back to home, and tells yeza she has to leave
  • He knows (always a fighter)
  • So she heads out
  • Does some adventuring on the side, to keep her pockets full (or full enough)
  • Meets a sly half orc and an overly optimistic tiefling and decides to stick with them, but doesn’t forget what goal she’s set out for herself
  • Meets the rest of them
  • Tries not to snarl when she sees nott
  • Gets to know her more, and it’s easier to separate her from the monsters that tortured her mother. They didn’t wear porcelain masks or carry ever-flowing flasks
  • —
  • When she first sees the dark skinned monk in blue robes across the tavern, she thinks, it can’t be. And then the tiefling catches her staring and their groups combine and she’s looking into the bright, beautiful, fierce blue eyes of her daughter, and she can’t-
  • She takes a big, long swig from her flask and deals with it, because fleeing from the table would not be conducive to keeping secrets
  • She sees how beau looks at her, the first few weeks they’re together
  • Can feel the hate and disgust she’s trying (and failing) to tamp down, and it hurts because she knew, knew that she couldn’t have gone back, but to have confirmed feels like a little piece of her soul has been burned away
  • Slowly, slowly, things get better
  • And then it all comes crumbling down around her when they go back to felderwin. Yeza is gone
  • Taken
  • And there’s no way to hide who she is, anymore.
  • —-
  • As nott tells her story, beau gets a twisty, sick feeling in her stomach
  • And then, those bright yellow eyes are turned on her, and she learns that her mother isn’t actually dead, but it’s almost, somehow, worse, because the way she’d treated her when they’d first met comes flooding back
  • And, and, beau doesn’t care if the rest of the group is still watching because, her mom’s not dead
  • And she’d missed her so much
  • (Caduceus herds the rest of them upstairs, and they wait, and give the two time. And themselves, time, to adjust to this drastic shift in group dynamics)
  • There’s lots of crying, and a little bit of anger on beau’s part, and way, way too much self loathing on nott’s veth’s mom’s part
  • But- her mom’s alive. Greener, and slightly, different from before, but alive, and in front of her
  • And that’s what matters
  • (i really need to figure out how to do read mores on asks, this is getting ridiculous)
trail.content:
I am so down for angst hell yes, this prompt is fucking delicious, let’s go-

  • When beau first gets the letter to come home, she’s excited.
  • She knows that yeza and veth have been trying for a third kid, and it’s not really the news to spread in a letter, so she swings by xenoth’s office, says she’s taking some personal time, and heads out
  • She can hear him yelling ‘monks don’t take personal time, beauregard!’ all the way across the grounds, and smiles a little
  • He’s high strung, but he cares about her, in his way
  • She just wishes it would maybe manifest itself as less lectures about how to be a Proper Monk
  • She hightails it home, and doesn’t realize something’s wrong until she sees that the apothecary is closed
  • It’s midday, they never close during the day
  • She ducks under the doorway, as is habit, and sees the circles under yeza’s eyes.
  • Sees the trauma lurking in luke’s and wants to pummel whoever put that into her brother’s eyes into the fucking ground
  • Looks around and doesn’t see veth. Stills, and asks in a trembling voice, “dad?”
  • He lurches forward, clinging to her, and whispers, “i’m so sorry”
  • They all start crying, and end up curled on the couch
  • He tells her the story, of how the winter had apparently been bad enough for the goblins that they got desperate. Enough to strike at the town. To take hostages. To take her family.
  • She has to pause there, as her vision whites out with the towering rage she feels at these, these creatures, these fucking disgusting, horrible- she takes deep breaths, until she feels less like she’s shattering into dozens of jagged shards, and keeps listening
  • Hears how her parents were tortured. Her brother starved. And has to breathe deeper
  • How desperate they’d gotten. Their frantic plan, whispered in the dark as luke shivered with fever
  • How they’d run and run and then veth had turned to him and kissed him fiercely and told him, “take our boy and go!” and lured the goblins away
  • How he’d barely made it to felderwin long enough for a crownsguard to see him
  • How they’d waited for a few days for her to come but- but. Nothing.
  • How there’d been a search party sent out (“i had to yell at them, beau. I nearly- i nearly threw acid in the lawmaster’s face because she didn’t think vethy was worth it-”)
  • But there’d been nothing-
  • And then there’d been her body
  • He’d sent the letter as soon as he’d been able to write, but he knew how slow mail could be
  • “We’re- having the funeral tomorrow. Only- only family”
  • And they had her funeral
  • Veth’s brothers came back from where they’d scattered, and beau held luke close throughout, and stared studiously forward. Her casket was filled with flowers, ones they’d all picked themselves from about the fields, but not a single one was as beautiful as her mom, even dead
  • After the funeral, beau stays with yeza and luke. She sends a terse letter explaining everything to xenoth, so he doesn’t get her kicked out, and ignores every letter he sends back
  • Eventually, her sadness is overaken by anger. Rage, at the creatures that had killed her mother (had tortured her, she’d seen the marks on her arms and legs, and painted across her neck)
  • So, she pays a group of crownsguard that look sufficiently competent, and storms a goblin camp
  • She can admit it’s not her best plan, and that she nearly dies far too many times, but- but, it does give her something. Information. A purpose. There was a woman- not a goblin, but they never saw her face.
  • She was hired to make the halfling woman suffer.
  • Beau gets everything she can from the little cretins, and then throws them away
  • She sees the looks the crownsguard are giving her, and throws them more gold. They look away
  • She goes back to home, and tells yeza she has to leave
  • He knows (always a fighter)
  • So she heads out
  • Does some adventuring on the side, to keep her pockets full (or full enough)
  • Meets a sly half orc and an overly optimistic tiefling and decides to stick with them, but doesn’t forget what goal she’s set out for herself
  • Meets the rest of them
  • Tries not to snarl when she sees nott
  • Gets to know her more, and it’s easier to separate her from the monsters that tortured her mother. They didn’t wear porcelain masks or carry ever-flowing flasks
  • —
  • When she first sees the dark skinned monk in blue robes across the tavern, she thinks, it can’t be. And then the tiefling catches her staring and their groups combine and she’s looking into the bright, beautiful, fierce blue eyes of her daughter, and she can’t-
  • She takes a big, long swig from her flask and deals with it, because fleeing from the table would not be conducive to keeping secrets
  • She sees how beau looks at her, the first few weeks they’re together
  • Can feel the hate and disgust she’s trying (and failing) to tamp down, and it hurts because she knew, knew that she couldn’t have gone back, but to have confirmed feels like a little piece of her soul has been burned away
  • Slowly, slowly, things get better
  • And then it all comes crumbling down around her when they go back to felderwin. Yeza is gone
  • Taken
  • And there’s no way to hide who she is, anymore.
  • —-
  • As nott tells her story, beau gets a twisty, sick feeling in her stomach
  • And then, those bright yellow eyes are turned on her, and she learns that her mother isn’t actually dead, but it’s almost, somehow, worse, because the way she’d treated her when they’d first met comes flooding back
  • And, and, beau doesn’t care if the rest of the group is still watching because, her mom’s not dead
  • And she’d missed her so much
  • (Caduceus herds the rest of them upstairs, and they wait, and give the two time. And themselves, time, to adjust to this drastic shift in group dynamics)
  • There’s lots of crying, and a little bit of anger on beau’s part, and way, way too much self loathing on nott’s veth’s mom’s part
  • But- her mom’s alive. Greener, and slightly, different from before, but alive, and in front of her
  • And that’s what matters
  • (i really need to figure out how to do read mores on asks, this is getting ridiculous)

blog.name: underwaterbanshee
blog.title: Underwater Banshee
blog.description: A Critical Role Side Blog || Not a Spoiler Free Blog || block #liveblogging? to avoid Thursday spoilers || Prioritizes the Ladies

summary: I’ve been watching super cuts during this little break and I think my favorite thing about Critical Role will always be how into...
body:
I’ve been watching super cuts during this little break and I think my favorite thing about Critical Role will always be how into it the other players are when it is not their turn. They make faces and giggle and fist pump and are completely engaged with what is going on around them, even when they are just whispering to each other.

It is such a generous friendship, no wonder most Critters are jealous and want what they have. I know I am.

blog.name: bixbiboom
blog.title: I myself am also Enchanter Pumat Sol
blog.description:
Bixbi, older than you.

Fat queer of indeterminate origin.

Possibly a lesser demon.

Hellenist serving Hestia, Hermes and Chiron.

Critical Role has taken over my life and my blog.

Taliesin Jaffe is my boyfriend.

I love you.

#eyesnevershut

description: nott has to watch the nein die. over and over and over again. and she can’t save them, can’t ever save them. until she does
